Reviews.Title: “Do not book here if you are staying because of an overnight connection”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1960
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it came up on the list of hotels near DFW. If you call 25 miles close then I guess it is. First, they don't provide shuttle service. Unless you call you won't know this. Second, when you tell one of the cabs outside the arrivals terminal were you want to go you get a quote for $50plus each way. And third, like a previous reviewer stated the night manager didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pnemiller
Reviews.Content: This place does not live up to the reviews we read. There were too many things that displeased us during our stay. Room key did not work a number of times, exercise room was closed, fridge in room kept freezing everything, cable on old TV did not have channels listed--HBO, PBS, you have to walk about 75 yards from the front to get to the elevators. There were some good points--good two date room rate, nice breakfast room and breakfast, comfortable bed. Seems to be better for conferences than as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst possible nightmare for travelers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ronsheline
Reviews.Content: I had my room double booked by mistake. At 1:30am some stranger walked in on my wife and I sleeping. Me being a 4 time war veteran, I literally almost killed a stranger for something that the hotel was responsible for. When I got downstairs the manager told me that I coul either check out right then and get a refund, or stay the rest of the 10hoirs till checkout and pay. The management never apologized and was consistently rude, to include trying to talk badly about me in Spanish while I was in front of them(they didn't know I spoke Spanish). Run and stay as far from this place as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Night manager is rude!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie1809
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in our room asleep when someone walked into our room saying it was there's. Our room was over booked!!!!! The manger was unhelpful and said that if we wanted to check out then we could but that's the only way we could get our money back. My husband is an iraq war veteran and almost attacked the person walking into our room but realized he was safe when I told him where we were. I will never stay here again! Our room key worked to all the doors down the 2nd floor hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent free breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: phillips16
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay. The staff is amazing. The room was small. However the breakfast buffet was excellent. I want the recipe for the homemade salsa for the eggs very good. Jamie the maintenance man was amazing. I forgot my purse by the pool and he got back to me safe. Essentially saving our whole trip and a lot of future headaches. Very thankful for that. My husband thought the fitness center was great for weight lifting and cardio.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great rates for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: chainboss
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Best Western several times through Hotwire. The hotel is a little older, it used to be a Wydnham, but that does not take away from the experience. It is well maintained with clean and comfortable rooms, a small but fair workout room, exterior pool and the best free breakfast in the metroplex. The hotel offers two for one drinks for new guests and has a restaurant in the hotel and a buffet attached. Next to the intersection of I 635 and Rt. 75 access to any part of the area is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Descent place in North Dallas but there is better.”
Reviews.Author: BSpeaker
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great, hot breakfast (best feature) with abundant hot & cold choices - Meeting rooms - Workout facility - Microwave-Fridge in every room. - Kind staff - Clean throughout - Elevator - Free wireless - Outdoor pool - Free parking - Good rate (Hotwire.com $51 per night) - Adequate channel selection - Close to many restaurants, shopping, etc. Cons: - Dubious reservation tactic (I booked a room for 4 but when checking in, was given a single bed room and told I had to pay $10 more per night for a double since I booked on Hotwire.com and according to the front desk, they just sought the lowest rate and not the beds. I have been using Hotwire.com since 2006 and never had this happened. Instead, I was provided a rollaway bed free of charge in the room). - Small bathrooms (sink, toilet, bath) - Our hot water was not working (it was repaired by the custodian) - The staff was always friendly but they weren't communicating well with each other in handling situations and they just seemed one step behind on what was expected. Summary: - If the price is right, book here; however, you can find better in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude!!! Bait and Switch Tactics..BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbtch
Reviews.Content: Staff at the front desk told me the night before that I would be getting a suite. When I asked to see the room or a similar room to what I would be in, the counter help quickly made up excuses saying that all the rooms were different and they couldn't guarantee which room I would get but that I WOULD get a suite. I told her that I understood but I would like to see one to get an idea of the property. At that point she told me she was the only person at the desk and she could not show me. I guess I should have known something was up right then. She avoided showing me a room like the plague. The next day I called for hotel information and a man answered the phone, he sneered at the suggestion that I would be getting a studio room through priceline. I explained that I had talked to a lady at the desk who had assured me that was what I was getting (i only booked it because it stated in the description "suite"). Once again he looks at me like I'm an idiot and assures me that I'm not getting a suite. With that said, The hotel lobby is pretty and slightly but not overly impressive. Chandeliers, book case, business center with only one pc that is continually occupied being capable of going on the internet. We are given a room key and told we would be staying on the 4th floor in a king bed room two beds were not available). We got on the elevator (which is entirely too small), but effective I guess..just really slow. As we walked down the hallways it had a weird burning tire smell to it, but I shrugged it off. We reached the door, opened it and immediately realized the room was soooo small! Terribly small. It was moderately nice...just way too small. The bathroom door was wroken and so was the toilet seat. There was water damage on the bathroom walls and ceiling. I called down to the front desk and asked two questions about the hotel, I was cut off mid sentence (was only allowed time to ask part of what I needed to know), They sounded annoyed that I had the nerve to bother them. I assumed they were busy, and just called back later. I got the same rude/short response and cut off. I went down to the lobby to ask the question when they weren't so busy. The two ladies at the desk refused to even look up when I spoke to them. They gave very short answers..just plain rude rude rude.. I've seen some reviews saying they had good service and I'm thinking they must have been employees because there is no way at all that the counter people could be considered helpful. I passed the workout room on the way back up to my room, I decided to take a look. I opened the door and was almost knocked to the floor from the disgusting odor of it. We also later ate at the cafe on the first floor, the hamburgers were not fully cooked..I gagged ..it was that raw in the middle. The fries were good. The drinks were tiny, but they did refill them as needed. The burger had a good smoked flavor if you could get past the raw middle. Overall I would NOT recommend this hotel unless they fire everyone on the front desk and start over with employees who realize they are in the "HOSPITALITY" industry. I'm still shaking my head at how rude the front desk people were. I was severely disappointed. If that wasn't bad enough, housekeeping comes through slamming every door on the floor over and over until you walk outside to see what is going on, and they stare you down for opening the door and looking..instead of realizing maybe they should keep it down. I would stay here only if you are desperate..don't expect hospitality or service..expect rude people, a decent room (but nothing to write home about)..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Service”
Reviews.Author: Crystal H
Reviews.Content: the service was great and the staff was very nice and courteous. We hosted our church banquet there in your beautiful designed dinning area.Thanks for the wonderful time there at the Best Western at 8051 LBJ Fwy,Dallas, Tx 75251.

Reviews.Title: “To be fair...”
Reviews.Author: Blur_78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other hotels in this area, but then I read the reviews from this hotel and I thought that it would be different than others, but actually it isn't; it is a big building and I was allocated at fifth floor, room was ok, it was clean without bad odors. Breakfast was average, some hot options available. I didn't like the area where it is located, definitively you wouldn't like to take a walk outside the hotel at nights... But for the price I think I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be improved, comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: FTopGirl
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and effecient and friendly. Room had a VERY comfortable bed and thehotel was relatively quiet and very comfortable. The bathroom was small, but it had good lighting and mirror. And the hairdryer was powerful - helped me get out fast in the mornings. We were a group of 14 of international travelers, ready to tip big... but the bar closed early when we there, very unapologetically, telling us to get some wine at the CVS across the street. I aslo got my 6:30am wakeup call at 5:30am - not impressive!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Circleof10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. It was New Year's and we felt very lucky to be able to book a room for 2 nights. When we got to the room, we were slightly disappointed at its small size, but again, it is an older hotel and the price was great! The bed was extremely comfortable and the service very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GoNext
Reviews.Content: My one night stay was pleasant at this Best Western Plus Hotel. The beddings and pillows were clean and comfortable. It was convenient with the microwave and refrigerator in the room. The buffet breakfast was okay. Overall, we'd recommend this Best Western Plus Hotel to any finicky travelers who would be pleased about it.

Reviews.Title: “you don't need more than that...excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Moshe_Simana
Reviews.Content: clean place human treatment great happy hour great Manager wondeful hotel i will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on every level”
Reviews.Author: JenCobb
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern, comfortable and clean. Way more luxurious than I would expect from the Best Western brand and their "Plus" properties are wonderful in all of the cities I've stayed (I travel every week). This property had exceptional service and their complimentary breakfast was wonderful with a lot of choices (healthy and indulgent - your choice!) Tina Kindel assisted our group of approximately 12 people and handled all of our needs expertly. To top off the experience, I lost a bag and did not realize for one month where I had left it. When I realized I had left it at this property (there were no id tags on it), I called and id'd it and it was shipped back to me the very next day! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Texas Instruments - business traveler friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandHolli
Reviews.Content: Very close to TI and a nice place to stay for a business trip. Clean, safe and quiet, they have an extra friendly staff and nice breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hattie M
Reviews.Content: Whenever our group has another tournament in your area, we will look to book with your hotel. The personnal was most helpful and the manager Tina Kindel went above and beyond to make sure our accommodations were as we requested. Thanks for the personnal attention from all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Conference Center Service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: I am the president of a Not-for-Profit organization in the Dallas area. We have been having monthly meetings that include dinner at this hotel for almost three years. The food is amazing, the prices are affordable, and I always feel well taken care of by our catering manager, Hugo Frausto. He is always very accessible, courteous and friendly. I would certainly recommend this hotel for all your event needs. I have not personally stayed in the hotel, but have booked our out of town guest speakers here, and they were very happy with the accomodations. Sarah C. Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alexrdvz
Reviews.Content: After realizing that this was the cheepest hotel in dallas in the top 50 of trip advisor I decided to book one night here. I happen to agree to several of the reviews here. The staff in the front desk was rude (during check-in only). The pillows are tall, short, and not very good. The bed is huge. I liked it. It is not nlise. It has breakfast included. That is always a Plus.... But nothing fancy, just convenient. It has a really good location. Banks and tons of restaurants nearby. 15 to 20 min drive from almpst everywhere in Dallas. My gps took me to the back part lf the hotel ( i need to get new updated maos maybe). My room was non-smoking but really smelled like smoke... Not too bad... But it did (didn't bother me so i didn't complain). The shower was ok and the bathroom in general was ok. I could tell they have done some remodeling in the rooms, but instead of getting new items for broken stuff in the bathroom, the used glu to put them back together.... Not very nice. Towels were not very good but they did the work. Pool is ok. Overal, i got what i payed for. Not thrilled about the place. I guess is ranked so high only cuz of the price. If you are trying to save money... Go for it. If it is a romantic trip.... Try something different. The free parking is a plus in this hotel, and I LOVED the gact that they had free wifi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl W
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Best Western Plus Dallas Hotel & Conference Center. My first trip was with a friend and we both enjoyed our stay. This time, I made a Hotwire reservation and very pleased to find out I had selected the Best Western again. It is clean and comfortable with friendly and helpful staff. The free continental breakfast is another perk. It is served a very elegant style in the the hotel's restaurant with lot of choices. The rate is unbeatable. I will definitely come back and will make this my hotel of choice for my trips to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Your perfect wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: Maribel A
Reviews.Content: No negative comments here... We had a GREAT experience planning and having our wedding here. I've listed several reasons why: 1. The Senior Catering Manager was great from beginning to end. 2. We dealt with him and nobody else. 3. He returned e-mails and/or phone calls in a timely manner. 4. The staff was also very polite, cooperative and professional. 5. The food was AWESOME..hats off to the chef!!! 6. The venue looked beautiful! 7. The Senior Catering Manager went above and beyond. Alonso

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: Haydee M
Reviews.Content: Best Western is my choice for my wedding venue this coming up November 2011. Hugo Frausto has made it such a great experience the whole way. He has been there to answer any questions me or my family have had. We just currently had our menu tasting for our event and it was perfect. He made sure the table was set properly and the food was delicious. He did a tasting to accomadate 4 people. My mom, my brother, my fiance and I were pleased and suprised :)!!! I can't till my wedding because I know Hugo and his team well have every detail taken care off. Defenately recommend Best Western for any event.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located but Gulliver must have lived here.”
Reviews.Author: ZepolL
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel attending a conference. It's location was ideal, close to a major road leading to downtown Dallas. Ofcourse, Texas is notorious for lots of driving space, hardly any walking areas and limited transportation. The hotel itself was clean, well appointed for the size with friendly staff. It was small enough so you could easily walk from your room to the elevator and to the conference areas as well as the dining room. Breakfast was nice, consisting of oatmeal, fruit, scrambled eggs, an assortment of breads but no bacon or sausage. One paid extra for this (in Texas?). Okay, basically, I'm giving thumbs up save for one thing. I'm thinking to save on building costs, the building provides rooms with precast concrete slab floors that also serve as the ceiling, making the already relatively small rooms seem even smaller. This is complemented by the tiny elevators, that once you cram your baggage cart in the cab which is measured exactly the same lenght as the cart, only 4 people can fit, 2 on either side of the cart. Other than this, it's a good hotel if you plan only to sleep and eat there, using up most of the day outside or in conference.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: buckyfanWi
Reviews.Content: After looking at all the other reviews, we booked our 2-night stay here. The staff was extremely nice, friendly front staff both at check-in and check-out and the bartender (think his name was Elijah!) was great as well. The room was comfortable and clean although a little dated. The continental breakfast in the mornings was above average and we actually ate on real plates using real silverware as opposed to the usual paper plates and plasticware. Food was good and had a decent variety. The main drawback was the crazy traffic getting to the hotel, but there is nothing the hotel can do about that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Board meeting!”
Reviews.Author: Nelda G
Reviews.Content: Tina Kindel helped facilitate a Board meeting involving 40 persons from across the state. All had high praise for the facility, the customer service, the catered meals and the welcoming atmosphere of the BW. We will be staying again, very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Diana Z
Reviews.Content: Hosted a small conference at this location largely to the excellent assistance from Tina Kindel the Best Western's Sales Director. Our associates were more than satisfied with the rooms and catering. Would do business with again in the near future. Service was extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tanveer A
Reviews.Content: I chose this only for the rates. But turned out be very good value for money. Except for the fact the the rooms are small. There was absolutely no problems at all. All the aspects, from breakfast, to uninterrupted wifi, and great coopertive staff. I will choose it again .

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: After the pleasant welcome and continued excellent customer service by Tina Kindel, I will always stay here when I'm in Dallas and I will also have my sales people stay here as well. You should clone Tina! Thank You, Ryan Hausher Royal MFG

Reviews.Title: “All things good”
Reviews.Author: Rodney S
Reviews.Content: We had a sales meeting and everything went very well.The Location was great, meeting room good, and food and staff did everything that was needed. Would recomend for meeting or for lodging and I would stay there again if I am in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: I had a great visit stay at the Best Western. The staff was great and they help set up a sales conference could not have asked more. Will stay there every time I visit Big D.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bew996
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a long 15 hour flight from Australia and despite being led on a circuit of Dallas by the GPS I arrived at the hotel to a pleasant reception. The room was clean and reasonable for 3 star although the TV was so blurred (possibly as it was 15 years old!) that you could only watch it from the opposite end of the room. The aircon unit was noisy too. Breakfast was fine for such a low priced hotel - I paid $ 58 and that included breakfast and Wifi. So overall, worth a visit if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Liyong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a kids chess tournament nearby. This hotel is conveniently located next to two freeways and yet it's relatively quiet from the freeway noise one would usually expect. Compared to most other Best Western hotels, this one seems one level higher with its own restaurant and conference rooms. The hotel also has a gym and an outdoor pool. We are a couple with a 10-year old child and stayed in a room with two queen size beds. The room has almost everything we needed: TV, small refrigerator, microwave oven, iron & board, hair dryer, coffer maker... The only drawback is there was only one chair. The best part is the hotel offers good complimentary hot breakfast excluding meat which costs extra. The hotel also has a Chinese buffet restaurant next door (but not very good food though), a McDonald's restaurant next door, a Subway restaurant and a CVS pharmacy across the street. The hotel is located in a safe area with some office buildings in the neighborhood. It's easy to find and easy to get on and off the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Dallas Confrerence Center is my favorite place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: William A
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often to Dallas for Busuness and sometimes Personal Trips. This Hotel has a great staff from top to bottom in every way. the management and front desk staff always go out of their way to take care of My reservations and check in. Tina, the sales manager always helps me get in my favorite rooms. Sometimes I have to deal with overseas during the night and sleep late the next day. the house cleaning staff is very friendly and always adjust my room cleaning time according to my schedule. the rooms are always clean and everything works. I sometimes use room service and the food is excellent and always delivered on time. The Internet is important to me and always works. I satay at a lot of Best Westerns around the US and due to the staff this is my Favorite !

Reviews.Title: “Meetings in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: slvierra
Reviews.Content: My company has numerous meetings in Dallas and our go to hotel is The Best Western Hotel and Conference Center. Clean, well priced and very very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean room at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: martinapescadora
Reviews.Content: Room was kind of dated, but clean and bed was confortable. Couldn't turn air conditioning off (which was rather noisy). Overall, price was worth it. Was very fortunate to have a GPS, otherwise I would have missed it! Breakfast could be better. Staff was very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice place. There were some drawbacks. The beds were double beds instead of queen sized. I specifically asked when making reservations and was told they had queen sized beds. We saw a roach in the room. Other than that, the people were nice and the rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler777655
Reviews.Content: After spending 20 min. in Dallas traffic and 105 degree weather trying to find the hotel, when I called front desk, he said he didn't know the area and had to transfer me, turn out the hotel was hidden behind some buildings and had no entrance sign. When I finally got to the front desk they had change my reservation to a double instead of a double room king suite, was going to charge me same price till I mention it. Then put a $50 hold on my debit card which left me with no money. When asked about paying cash, they said it's a $100 deposit , what is the use of going anywhere if all your money goes for the hotel room. Then to add injury to insult, the room was nothing more than a nice motel 6. Never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Place is ready for wrecking ball”
Reviews.Author: James Q
Reviews.Content: No movie channels Dirty carpets Elevator is European its so small Theo in the bar is tops

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly good!”
Reviews.Author: skydriver332
Reviews.Content: Friends; This hotel is really the top of the bill!! A short list: Hotel staff: Very friendly & helpfull! The rooms: Sparkling clean and spacious, with everything in perfect working order! The Bar: Very nice, with Theo behand the bar! The pool: Relaxing & clean! Breakfast: Wonderful!! And last bud not least; we got here through a roomsaver coupon, and the value offered for the $55 we paid is just incredible!!

Reviews.Title: “Low end 3 star”
Reviews.Author: mfenet
Reviews.Content: After arriving for our sporting event the drama started. My friend had to be put in a bridal suite since they messed up her reservation. Then the second nite they made her move. Therefore, she had to put her stuff in my room before moving to another. Another mother's hairdryer erupted into sparks so she had to come to mine. Their are many rooms located before you get to the elevator. Therefore at all hours of the nite you hear everything. My room was located next to the electrical closet so we heard a horrible noise on a periodical basis. They have a policy no food or drinks out of the complimentary breakfast area. On morning of checkout the hot water went out in my room. I went to the front desk and they said they would send up maintenance. An hour later which would be checkout time no maintenance. I had to go to another room for hot water. NEVER EVER will any parent from our sporting event team stay here again. Sad thing is we come every weekend to dallas and their response was we were busy. Isnt that the goal. to be busy???

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: catfish1814
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable, bed was superb in comfort, microwave and fridge very convenient. Breakfast was outstanding with a buffet of variety. We had drinks in the bar that evening and the dinner was delicious, entire staff professional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value and Superbly Clean”
Reviews.Author: TXbigcheese
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised by this hotel. I travel for work and have a 'thrifty' budget and it was great not having to compromise on quality and comfort. The staff are really friendly especially Theo who worked in the bar was full of conversation. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was spotless but smaller than some hotels. I had a good nights sleep as the big king size bed was super comfy and it had lots of pillows. The breakfast in this hotel is fantastic and free. They also sell breakfast burritos and made to order omelets for around $4 or $5. I opted for the omelet which as delicious. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “3 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: JOSH11211
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing trip to Dallas, we had a hugh conference in town and had 50 rooms at the hotel. Staff, Restaurant, Bar, Rooms everything was perfect. We enjoyed our group rate of $69. Any time we are in Dallas this is our Hotel, bravo Best Westerns.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: HenryT949
Reviews.Content: I checked into a dark lobby with a texas size roach crawling across the lobby floor to hear the night clerk giggle(a gentlemen of Indian decent) when i expressed my concern of the roach making the lobby his home not to mention the breakfast area was where he was heading. I was checked in and instructed to walk down a hallway to the elevators which were the slowest elevators at 1am, as I entered the room it was boiling HOT the fan was not even on I guess they are a GREEN $AVING hotel, I was exhusted from my flight in so I proceeded to lay down for some rest about 1 hr into my sleep I feel something crawling on my neck and chest I quickly turned on the light and there were more than 10 BED BUGS crawling on my body and another 20 in the bed and sheets I removed the sheeting and the matress was saturated in BED BUGS I quickly contacted the desk and the desk clerk was no help stating that I would have to wait until the morning for this to be resolved, I quickley gathered my belonging and went to a neighboring hotel Embassy Suites, I am still yet to hear a response from the Manager in regards to my refund I have contacted my credit card company to dispute the charge... DONT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than imagined”
Reviews.Author: MYC1
Reviews.Content: I got this reservation on Hotwire-I was disappointed when it was at a Best Western-I didn't have a good impressive of their hotels, but the price was so reasonable - I had hoped it wouldn't be too bad. The hotel turned out to be very nice!! The rooms were nice and clean and we had a garden/pool view. The breakfast was GREAT! Fresh fruit, super oatmeal, eggs, etc. My only complaint would be the air conditioner-it worked just fine, but would cut off so I didn't have the white noise when the fan is blowing all the time. It did wake me up when it came on and shut off, but the room was cool and the beds were very comfortable. I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: LubbockTexas
Reviews.Content: were should I begin?the sink was really small.there were hairs all over the bathroom.The bathroom was tiny .the room service wasn't avalible when I needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: JoeyLarson
Reviews.Content: PROS: Clean, happy & friendly staff (note: Marlene at front desk), great location right off I-635. No noise from traffic. The best included breakfast ("continental +") of all our hotel stays over 30 years! CONS: could easily hear noises in halls; no restaurant, although offfered one evening special - but offered the same "special" two nights in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel that is just okay”
Reviews.Author: OK_taqi
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms at this hotel on hotwire for a great price and I got what I paid for. The hotel is old with small rooms. It is located close to 2 highways, but I did not hear noise from them. An extra fee of $10 was charged for a room with 2 beds. I was also charged $50 for each room for incidentals which is to be refunded within 7 days. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The hallways were dirty and bathrooms were small. The breakfast was good with plenty of fresh fruit, eggs, potatoes, french toast, and the other usual stuff. The outdoor pool was nice, but small. We did not use room service. There are other hotels in the area that are much nicer and I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to be remodeled or replaced with a new one.”
Reviews.Author: baillie10
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The desk clerk even gave me a room away from the interstate, so it was quieter. The pool area was nice and secluded, and there was a free breakfast but it was not that great. Pastries, some fruit (some not ripe and some over ripe), potatoes, eggs, pancakes that stuck together, and cereal. No meat, waffles, or yogurt...but it was food and free. The hotel was old and needed painting, even in the rooms. The carpet was old and musty smelling (stained in my room). My room was small, furniture was garage sale shape, chips out of the door frames, old clunker (26-27 in) tv with wavy lines through some channels, pedestal bathroom sink (which meant no br cabinet space at all), bed was uncomfortable, sheets worn with small holes (clean). Not green hotel at all. No recycling and coffee maker single serve plastic with waxed cups (which can't be recycled as paper). The coffee maker was on top of the entertainment center, which was impossible for me to reach and make coffee unless I stood on a chair. The neighborhood was not good (I would not take a walk), and basically you ate at McDonalds, the hotel, or a Chinese buffet in the hotel (which the workers that I asked had never tried). You had to drive to find anything else.` Easy access to freeway, when I left. Good thing I got a cut price on Expedia, but they rated it as a 3 star (and I did the know the hotel that I chose route, not the cheaper unknown one). It is definitely not a 3 star (more like 2.5), and now I will not trust the Expedia rankings anymore. As I said, the staff was good (not their fault it is an older hotel and needs remodeling), but I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay, fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: acmatunl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights using their "Stay 3 Nights" promotion, so we paid just under $60/night), saving us a lot compared to nearby hotels (which averaged around $90/night). The room included a recliner, fridge, microwave, desk w/computer chair, king sized bed, TV (no flatscreen!?) and entertainment center, iron/ironing board. Pros: -Great, free breakfast. Includes eggs, biscuits & gravy, seasoned potatoes, pancakes, fresh fruits & yogurt, croissants, donuts/Danishes, cereals, oatmeal, etc. Really good way to start off the day. - Just a 10 minute or so drive to downtown - Nice rooms, although they seemed a little cramped - Bed and pillows were comfortable - Very friendly staff. We interacted with around 6 staff members, and all were extremely nice - Free wireless internet - Bus route right outside the door, which gives you easy access to a nearby DART station Cons: - The air conditioner is SO LOUD! There are probably fully-functional helicopters that make less noise than that thing. When it turns on, you can't hear the TV or anyone in the room with you. They need to update those things. - We found a pizza box on top of our TV that had half of a pizza in it. It was our second night there, so I'm not sure how long that had been there. - There isn't a lot happening in the vicinity of the hotel. There are some fast food restaurants, a terrible buffet, and a CVS, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 week stay”
Reviews.Author: Dodie11
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel easily, welcomed by a friendly staff who continued to be courteous throughout our stay. Problem with non-smoking room but smelled of smoke was addressed promptly with a change of room. This was also our experience with Best Western in Memphis. Good buffet breakfast - with healthy oatmeal, fruits and choice of healthy options. Fitness room was well equipped and again non-working treadmill fixed.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, there's no better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ladytraveler29
Reviews.Content: Buffet breakfast with fresh fruit, eggs, potatoes, hot oatmeal, juice, coffee, breads and more. Helpful, friendly staff. Excellent, high speed internet (very important for business uploads). The rooms are updated and very clean, though small. There is a pedestal sink in the bathroom and no counter space. These, however are VERY minor compared to the value....couldn't do better anywhere at this price. This is my second stay here and I will surely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked very well for our occasion. Booked over a weekend for a reasonable rate, the hotel was a pleasant surprise. Good condition, nice bar, very comfortable and attractive room. Service overall was good especially in the bar. Two down comments: First, is the first free hot breakfast I"ve been to where you had to pay to get bacon or sausage. Seemed odd and a bit chintzy to me. Second, the remote entrances with keycard entries only worked on rare occasions. Certainly an aggravation especially on a multiple day stay when returning late at night. Other than those two things, a pleasant stay at this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: maggie1001_11
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at in Dallas for one night at the Best Western Hotel & Conference Center. Although it was a bit difficult to get there since it's hidden along the side of LBJ freeway, I was able to manuever around the area nicely. It is an older hotel that had been remodeled but it had all the amenities you would need for a short stay. The elevators are a bit tight probably only 3 people with small luggage could fit comfortably. The rooms were nicely appointed although there was not enough counter space in the bathroom to put your toiletries on. Free internet on two computer was convenient. The full breakfast (without meat) was more than adequate and the staff was pleasant.. It was a very good deal considering the amount I paid. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Mojo1988
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised with how nice this Best Western was. Room was very clean and nicely appointed. Be aware that the rooms are a little small but still quite comfortable. My only complaints are that the mini-fridge was a little noisy when it kicked on, and that quite a few of the television stations were not clear. I always find that quite strange in today's world of technology. I would think a hotel would get great reception through their cable or sat. provider.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: cecilhall
Reviews.Content: Virtually every aspect of this hotel experience was pleasant! We needed 32 rooms for our event at the end of December. We found this hotel online...and then we drove 700 miles round-trip, to comfirm this hotel was what it claimed to be. It IS everything it claims to be. Sales Manager, Tina Kindel, from "first impression" to "closing the books", always left us feeling like we got the best end of the deal! The service was everything one would hope for, and more, in a great hotel conference experience. Staff was friendly! Desk was helpful. The facilities were up-to-date! Plenty of parking! Food was good, and plenty of it! The bed was excellent! Had a strong WiFi signal in the room! It was CLEAN! The only "negatives" were: 1) a bit of a glitch with a bitter maintenance man (for which the desk and management fervently apologized) and 2) Some of the vending machines didn't work. If Tina and Marlenne (Desk clerk) are the face of this hotel.......the owners can be VERY proud!

Reviews.Title: “Room was smaller than average. Quiet. Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: chinagrl22
Reviews.Content: Considering all the places that I've stayed so far... this was smaller size than average hotel room. The breakfast was better than most places(buffet style). Room was quiet. Staff was helpful in mentioning places to eat later in the evening. Location suited us because it was only about 10 miles from JFK memorial and Holocaust Museum. (Both are worth seeing for sure).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in a long time....”
Reviews.Author: tammywilson64
Reviews.Content: Room was large and clean, very nicely kept. Will definately stay there again when I come to Dallas. $110 a night for a 2 room suite 5 minutes from Medical City was great. Breakfast was AWESOME a real breakfast to fill you up.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for the 3rd time”
Reviews.Author: TexasJ30
Reviews.Content: I went to DFW recently for a 2 day business trip. I stayed one night at the Best Western at 635 and 75. This was my 3rd time to stay here in the last year. The hotel is a good value and the staff is friendly. This hotel is not the Westin or the Ritz Carlton, its a good Best Western. It clean, in a good location, a good value, and they give you a decent breakfast. I stayed ther for $50, you can't beat this hotel for the price in north Dallas. I would reccomend this hotel for the solo business traveler who wants to find a place to put their head down for 6 to 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excelent value, very good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: vicenters
Reviews.Content: Great staff, excelent value, very good breakfast. The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ron-DK
Reviews.Content: Fair prices - but a hotel that needs redecoration. During a weeks stay key card had to be reprogrammed 10 times !! The front desk said that you had to take care not to leave the keycard close to other magnetic cards and cell phones !! In house wireless Internet very slow. Breakfast below average - after two days we had breakfast at a restaurant. The neighboruhood is quite OK and you feel safe when parking your car at nighttime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for a great night's stay”
Reviews.Author: mntwinfan
Reviews.Content: Was traveling through Texas. Decided to stay over in Dallas. Selected this hotel from a travel coupon book. They offered a great deal for very comfortable room. I had stayed at two other BW's in Texas earlier in the week -- both more expensive but were not as comfortable as this room/hotel. Breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at Best Western”
Reviews.Author: cassie77775
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here with our 3 children. It is right in the middle of everything we need-plenty of shopping, restaurants, and things to do. The hotel free breakfast is great-they not only provide cold cereal but also eggs, fresh waffles, and sausage, as well as quite a few other selections! We choose this hotel every time we travel and have never been disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff (front desk and bar) was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: yokrickett21
Reviews.Content: I came to Dallas for a wedding recently with some friends and was quite surprised at the Best Western we stayed at. It was very nicely decorated and the rooms were spacious and surprisingly cozy. I was really surprised at how gracious and courteous the front desk staff were, and to see the hotel had a bar too being a Best Western. Marlene, Marissa, and Erica were very friendly and respectful as well as helpful when it came to our needs. The bartender Theo, who I must say was very friendly and knowledgeable, obliged us with great conversation and drinks. He is definitely someone you should stop in and say hello to, and to sample his very delicious drinks. All in all I was quite happy with my stay and my friends and I had a great time! I highly reccommend staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: eweber10
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with courteous front desk. My wife forgot her toothpaste and within a minute of calling the front desk, there was a knock on the door with a complimentary tube. Hot breakfast with pancakes, eggs, rolls and fresh fruit was nicely presented and included with our room making it a super value. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel was quiet making our weekend very relaxing. Easy access to the LBJ and within minutes of the Galleria was a plus with my wife. Pool and exercise room were top notch though we didn't use them. Other perks were high speed internet access and complimentary drinks at the bar. Will stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good food, very good value”
Reviews.Author: steeler85
Reviews.Content: The location for our needs is excellent - easy on/off of major highways. The breakfast food was good quality and kept full and the temperature good. Service was good and staff did a nice job. Value was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff..Great Place..Great Stay...=)”
Reviews.Author: Valarie13
Reviews.Content: i very much enjoyed my stay here, staff was very nice, so was the room, lobby and breakfast. The cleaning staff was very polite and would leave a paper for what is for dinner at the hotel that night. The bar was very quaint and cozy. They also had a computer area next to the lobby. The bed was very comfortable so were the sheets, very clean. i stayed in room 446, the view wasnt all that great but i loved the room, which did come with a fridge and microwave. The only thing, which didnt bother me was the ac unit made a lil noise and my room card key, i had to have them change it twice. i so miss the regular keys. The hotel also offered room service with a 2 dollar charge. The breakfast was nice, i only used it once. It did have a variety of hot and cold food and also with fruit. The staff was there, to make sure the food was filled and tables were cleaned. There is also a Mcdonalds right next door and a chinese super buffet in the same parking lot on the side. *Note- when traveling here, i would recommend using Coit road, instead of lyndon b.johnson parkway,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice front desk”
Reviews.Author: mlreugger
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and the front desk was very helpful. They serve a complementary breakfast which was very good. There is a nice lounge for a drink and they also serve food which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: MelloMan07
Reviews.Content: I've been up in Dallas for the last two months working! Found this place about a month and a half ago. Lets just say I won't stay any were else! They have a great staff first an for most! The rooms are just beauitful with tons of fluffy pillows, feather down comforters, soft sheets, a recliner, fridge, microwave and a very modern bathroom which is spacious! Lets not forget they super clean which is deffinatly a plus! Lets get into some other fine details so i can rap this thing up and go watch some football! There resturaut has a very full menu and good food to boot! Other pluses include a hot breakfast and that doesn't mean oatmeal! They have a very wide spread to kick off your morning! For later they have a solid gym and swimming pool which is the deepest i've ever seen at a hotel going as deep as 8ft! So why not finish the night off with a little nite cap! Thats right a nice little pub right there next to the resturant!! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Dealcatcher123
Reviews.Content: We just visited Dallas for leisure. My overall stay was very satisfactory. Hotel doesn't have any problem upgrading my room to two double bed, even though hotwire booked king bed for stay with kids. I enjoyed the ambiance and stay. I would have rated 5 if they waived my upgrade fee.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING Pillow was on the bed....”
Reviews.Author: andrewt333
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I have traveled to many places throughout the world - staying at some of the nicest hotels and some of the worst hotels. I can deal with broken A/C's, cockroaches, and many other things that other's can't handle. Although, this is the WORST case scenario. One of the pillows in the room had BLOOD on it. It's unmistakable and wasn't something else such as lipstick, etc. Upon checkout (I only stayed one night), I had mentioned the presence of blood on the pillow - something we didn't leave behind. The receptionist, nonchalantly, said thank you very much, we'll have it changed. It's a shame but it's unhygienic to the worst levels. Otherwise, the hotel was cheap, decently located for what we needed, and the burger in the bar wasn't too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer and banquet service and food was great!”
Reviews.Author: shinerboy5
Reviews.Content: We held a banquet at the hotel. Tina Kindel worked with us in planning the event and I could not have asked for a more pleasant planner to work with. She was knowledgeable and worked with our budget. The hotel staff was friendly and very accomodating. The banquet dinner was outstanding and the tables were set beautifully. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your $$, even if you get a good deal!!”
Reviews.Author: westieluvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book this hotel since the reviews seemed to be good for the most part (after all, it's ranked #30 of 186 hotels in Dallas, right??) We got a really cheap deal (should have been a clue). Said the regular rate was $79/night, and we got it for $50. When we first checked in, they put us in a room on the 2nd floor. As we got off the elevator on that floor, the smell was almost enough to make me sick. It smelled like stale chicken noodle soup. I'm not sure if it was actually someone's food on that floor, or if it always smelled like that. When we got to our room, the bed was half made. There was a pile of linens on the floor with a note saying "no touch". There was a half drank Sprite sitting on the desk, and several pieces of trash (ie. receipts, papers). We went down to the front desk, and after calling housekeeping, they said, "oh, that room is already occupied." NICE! They then put us in another room (right next door to the original one). It was in order when we walked in, but upon further inspection, there were hairs all over. The bed had at least 3 dark black hairs mingled in with the sheets. It appeared there was a pubic hair on the A/C unit, and a long black hair on the bathtub. I refused to even use the tub the next morning for a shower, as it appeared not particularly clean itself. It's apparent that this is an older hotel. They have tried to put a new coat of paint on things, and maybe hang some newer picutres in the rooms, etc. but it's very evident that furniture, carpets, bath fixtures, etc are old. My husband attempted to pick up the room phone to call the front desk that night, but the phone didn't work. He then walked over to the OTHER phone, and it did not work either!! We were looking online at other hotels in the area, seriously considering leaving that night, but I'm very pregnant and was exhausted by the time this day was over. So, I decided to sleep wrapped up in the blanket I brought from home (since I knew it was actually clean) and use my own pillow. My husband wrapped his hotel pillow in an extra shirt he had. Then, to top things off, when we got home, I checked our bank account online. We had a $50 charge from the hotel! When I called I spoke with George. He explained that they put a hold on your card for 5-7 days. He said someone should have told you that when you checked in. The funny thing is, HE WAS THE ONE THAT CHECKED US IN!! At check-in he explained that the card would not be charged at all, only for "incidentals". The only decent thing I can say about this stay (other than it's over now), is that the breakfast was halfway decent. Things appeared to be fresh and clean. They give you vouchers when you check in for the breakfast buffet. You walk in and nobody checks anything. You just go through the line and get your food, then sit down. Anyone could walk in off the street and have breakfast there evidentally. Bottom line is....we typically stay at nicer hotels (Doubletree, Marriott), but decided to take a chance on a good deal with good reviews. I'm not sure where the other people that reviewed this hotel stayed, or what they're used to, but don't waste your $$! Spend the extra $25-$75 it might cost and get a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: missy1968
Reviews.Content: We checked in late, met the nicest staff named Marrissa/Jennifer they were just so friendly.Thank you for such a wonderful place for the night, we enjoyed the hot food the next mornng for breakfast and are back home.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME BREAKFAST FRIENDLY FRONT DESK & CLEAN ROOMS : )”
Reviews.Author: BOSSDOGG
Reviews.Content: So I took a trip out to Dallas Texas for my Friends wedding & I stayed @ the Best Western -Dallas Hotel and Conference Center for 9 days ill admit after I booked my Room with these guys I was a little worried cause the price was so cheap and affordable but when I got there I Checked in & went up to room 654 & wow I was totally impressed with my Room it was awesome Nice Big King Size Bed Free Wireless Internet Ice Cold AC & Very clean but thats not even the best part about this place the best part is the CUSTOMER SERVICE @ this place its simply amazing from the maintenace guy to the front Desk everyone is very helpful & friendly but the standout had to be MARLENNE MATTEI (Front Desk) this women dose whatever she can do to make your stay more comfortable she really dose take care of you this hotel has everything a Gym a bar a pool good room service & a awesome breakfast buffet & of course the excellent customer service so if you need a room in Dallas Texas Check it out

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carshowqueen2001
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice hotel. Breakfast was ok. It was nice their was a bar on location. AC was cold and the bed was pretty comfy. The ac was pretty loud but all in all it was a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: kofidoe
Reviews.Content: the hotel is centrally located, you can go anywhere in the dallas forth worth area.. the breakfast is the best and the restaurant is incredible. we ate steak from the restaurant and all i can say is wow. the bed is comfortable and they offered buy one get one free drinks at the bar. i will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a helpful staff and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Spectra8216
Reviews.Content: My family wanted to spend a few days with our elderly uncle and aunt so we looked for a hotel close to their home. That is how we were so lucky to end up here. The staff is pleasant and helpful and you will find the rooms VERY clean. (That was important to us!!) Marlenne, at the desk, was so kind when asked for directions or advice. This location is great for a North Dallas visit. The bed was wonderful!!!! Slept like a baby!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: john45cc
Reviews.Content: Not the Ritz, and rooms are on the smaller side, but very clean and comfortable. This hotel has everything you need, a very helpful front desk staff, a good free breakfast (try the hot sauce!), free parking and free internet. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: kcps
Reviews.Content: The room is very small compared to other hotels. I liked everything except the bathroom. Some bad smell (so weird!!) whenever I used water in the room. Very bad experience in this one so I dont know if I am very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small room and inconvenient layout”
Reviews.Author: sablank
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and overall the hotel was very nice and the people at the desk were very nice; Leticia (?) in the restaurant was very personable and accommodating. However, the back doors being locked was a major inconvenience. We pull a trailer and had to park at the back of the hotel and therefore we had to walk all the way around the buildilng to go in the front door, carrying stuff in from our convention, or food or whatever. I understand you do this for security reasons, but having a key slot would be more than sufficient to deter any unwanted guests from getting in. Other hotels do this and they don't have a problem. Spending entire days at the convention and working, being exhausted after having to walk over a mile to get to the convention ctr because of parking and then we had to walk around to the front door which we felt was unnecessary. Also, we never could get movies on our tv - sent a maintenance man to ck it out and he said something was wrong with the cables upstairs and would try to fix. Never did. The room was very small, but clean; other than that, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it but we'll prob. pick one closer to Market Center next time.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: la-la-Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in had a musty smell and I thought the rooms were small. The bathroom was small and dark. There was no counter space to put my curling iron, toothbrush, makeup, etc. The bed was very comfortable and the room seemed clean enough, although they could come in and repaint the ceiling in the room we had. I liked the breakfast in the morning and they had quite an assortment of things to eat. Didn't interact with the staff much, just to check in and get a restaurant. They seemed friendly enough but overworked, in my opinion. With all the other hotels in the area I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: 5onthe5
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed here for one night. The lobby was really nice which was great because we had to wait for a while to get checked in. There was only one guy behind the desk to check everyone in and answer the phone. There were other women in the office that kept looking out, but they never helped the poor guy out. When we got up to our rooms, I opened the door to mine and the musty smell was really overpowering. My parents room next door was a bit better, but still smelled musty. I turned on the fan hoping it would get better, but it didn't so I went down to the front desk and asked to be moved, which they did without hesitation. The next room was across the hall and had a slight musty smell but I thought I could put up with it for one night. The bathrooms were really small and just have a pedestal sink, so if you have a curling iron or something else to put out in the bathroom you're out of luck. They looked like they had been recently updated, but they were really dirty. The bathtub was stained and the wall behind the door was also stained with brown streaks (I didn't want to know what that was!) Despite the smell, the room itself seemed clean. The beds were super comfy. The guy at the front desk was really nice, but they really need to help out when there are more than a couple people in line. The breakfast was good as well. All in all, I can't say it was the worst place I have stayed, but it's not a place I would recommend either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: ashlux_osu
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the bad (it's more or less nitpicking). What little interaction with the staff that we had, it wasn't pleasant but it wasn't horrible either (the woman at the counter gave us a little attitude). After the initial annoyance with us asking her to check us in, she got everything taken care of quickly. The next problem with this hotel is its layout. I like to take the stairs whenever possible but the stairs are only available for going outside and they're locked from the outside, even with a room key. Now on to the good. The complimentary breakfast was surprisingly nice. The value was great (we got a room on Memorial Day weekend for $29/night); impossible to beat that price! Wireless internet was free and I can't complain about the speed. Our room had a microwave and fridge; that's not something I'm used to seeing in hotels but maybe times have changed. The location was sufficient for what we came for: musicals at AT&T PAC and Music Hall, JFK museum and memorial, and the Dallas Holocaust museum (expect a 12-15 minute drive to get to any of those locations on weekends). Bonus tip: Right across the street is Burger Bueno. Go there if you want a good fresh burger at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the money but don't ever forget to take the bill, you wont get later ever..!!”
Reviews.Author: koteshwarraoj
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms, good room service, decent room size, comfortable bed, good pool, good bar, nice breakfast. Due to hurry while leaving the I did not take the bill and the person in the reception promised me saying he is gonna e-mail the bill, which I need to get it reimburse. So I called them and asked for it and every time they get to know that I have called for a bill not for reserving a room, they will put me in hold and never turn up, every time..!!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: trioogy
Reviews.Content: The room was not available when we arrived, we were asked to leave and come back later. That was at 2pm, at 3pm the listed check-in time-we were told the room is still not available. No reason was given. At nearly 4pm we were finally allowed to check in, my husband was not allowed to check in for us, because my id was not given. I've never had to give my id (unless in a foreign country) when my husband and I are both listed on the reservation and share a last name. She was rude beyond belief and had a chip on her shoulder.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated and great price!”
Reviews.Author: djz032070
Reviews.Content: Check in and out were easy and quick without much friendliness. Lobby, lounge and breakfast buffet area were all nice with plenty of food choices and a full bar (though didn't sit in there). Rooms were small but updated with awesome beds (had 2 doubles), a micro/fridge, a/c, flat screen and clean bathroom. Pool looked clean and small. Decent area. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies of the Night”
Reviews.Author: Traveluxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel by default. My flight was cancelled while I was in Dallas and I had to find a hotel to overnight. Expedia gave me a $50 hotel credit so I tried to find a hotel that I did not have to spend much more money, since I had already had to extend my vacation(rental,food, etc). I checked out the BW Conference Center because it had good reviews and the cost for one night stay was only $52. I was skeptical at first but my husband and I figured it was only for one night and they did have good reviews. Well I will just say you get what you pay for. The hotel itself does not look bad it's just that because maybe the rates are so low it attracts another "element" of clientele. When we went to check in the woman at the desk told us we would have to wait because check in was not until an hour or so, as we went to have a seat in the lobby area I noticed they had a conference event going on, this motel must be known for that because the conference goers seemed to be very happy. but then I noticed a woman who was sitting near us having a phone converstaion telling someone to meet her at the hotel, she looked like she was high on something and her heels where even higher she then started talking loudly cursing into the phone and said she will just meet them across the street. When we went over to the desk there was another young woman who was in front of me and she was telling the clerk she needed to get back into the room because she left her shoes in the room she had no luggage and was dressed "sparingly" she looked like she was high and antsy. At this point I was concerned about the rooms and when I talked to the clerk I asked her about the clientele she acted like she did not know what I was talking about and she reassured me that this was a very nice hotel and that we would enjoy our stay she asked if I would like to upgrade to a suite for $30 more I said yes thinking that maybe the suites were more nicer than a regular room. We walked into the"suite" and it had a faint stale smell and the furniture was old and dark my husband refused and said it looks like the "party" room so we went back and got a regular room which was actually alot better it was clean even though it was small for a one night layover it was fine. This motel looks like it was a older motel before and it was spruced up low ceilings in the hallways, dark and very tiny elevators. This is not the kind of place I would stay for more than one night and I definitely would not stay here again. I think the management should look into what kind of businesss there clientele are into and try to discourage this activty in there motel. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: EZ_Traveling
Reviews.Content: I planned and hosted an event working with Hugo at the hotel. Hugo was very accomondating and detail oriented. The facilities were set up as expected and the guest rooms. clean and comfortable at a great price! The front desk staff was very friendly. I look forward to working with this hotel for future events!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: dkjonestx
Reviews.Content: I unexpectedly found myself looking for a hotel in Dallas 24 hours before I was to arrive. I found the Best Western - Dallas Hotel and Conference Center. The location was very convenient, and the price (less than $60 per night) was low enough to make me consider maybe looking for a different hotel. Since I was traveling alone, I decided to go ahead and book a room. I AM SO GLAD I DID!!! The location ended up being perfect for everything I had to do while in Dallas. However, this was secondary to the hotel itself. I arrived late (11:30 p.m.) the employees behind the counter were very friendly and mannerly. I was still skeptical as to what I would find behind the door to my room. When I got to my room, I was more than pleasantly surprised! First the room was clean and fresh. Very nicely appointed! There was a king sized bed, wing chair, desk with chair, refridgerator, microwave, television and a dresser. I have stayed at much more expensive hotels and not been near as impressed as I was with this Best Western. Now, the rooms are not giant sized rooms, so if you need huge rooms you should go pay lots more for a different hotel. The next day, every staff member I encountered, from the maintenance men to the general manager, were friendly, courteous and sincere. I guarantee I will be staying at the Best Western - Dallas Hotel and Conference Center my next trip to Dallas, whether I am travelling alone or with family and/or friends. Thank you and great job to everyone at Best Western!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town - Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: WKeithTM
Reviews.Content: Great Helpful Friendly Staff. Rooms are nice and clean. I have stayed in 15+ Hotels in the Dallas/Fort Worth area, and for the price, this is the best deal in town. I have spent 13 nights over my last three at this hotel. Some of the Pros: - Located - Lyndon B. Johnson Expressway blocks away from North Central Expressway - Great Friendly Staff, very prompt to resolve any issues - Good Breakfast which includes: 2-3 choices of cereal, 2-3 choices of Fresh Fruit, Hot Oatmeal, Maple Syrup for rotating starch like Pancakes, Waffles or French toast. They also have Home Style Potatoes and Scrambled Eggs with good ole Texas Salsa on the side. - Nice Bar on site and good room service. - Chinese Super Buffet shares the parking lot. Then you have tons of other restaurants with-in 2 miles: Burger Bueno, Benihana, Boston Market were my choices for dinner. - Equipped Fitness Center with Elliptical, Treadmill, Stationary Bike, Weight Machine and Free Weights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Ali12384
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Location was perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: ddumbleton
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a very enjoyable experience. Its location was ideal for easy access to and from the interstate. What I enjoyed most about my stay was the hospitality of the staff and their consideration for making my stay as comfortable as possible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful place to stay with a hospitable and friendly staff that are customer oriented, and for anyone who is looking for a place that is very central and remote to the major interstates, destinations, and sights of the DFW area. Even though my stay was only 3 days, I enjoyed every moment of it. I would not hesitate to make another reservation at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I nice way to take a break on my special day - my birthday.”
Reviews.Author: anchorwoman2006
Reviews.Content: Originally, I went online to find a hotel that was nice & reasonably priced. After finding one that I thought met my needs, I called the hotel. They were nice & helpful. I reserved my room for that Friday night. I was a little late in my arrival but I met welcoming smiles from the attendants. I was immediatly checked in & given my key. The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated. I went to my room & found the guestroom to be nicely decorated as well. I have pictures to prove it. I went down to the lobby to play around on the computer. They were a little slow in starting up but after a few minutes, I was surfing the web. My bed was comfortable. And I rested well. I had my first room service which I enjoyed. It was so much food on that plate that I saved some for breakfast. I guess that's why I forgot about the continental breakfast. But that's okay b/c I was full from my leftovers. My check out was smooth & quick. I received my deposit back & I was on my way. I plan to room there again in the near future. And I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than others”
Reviews.Author: lesothobob
Reviews.Content: The Best Western had the amenities needed for a very comfortable business trip. There was coffee in the room, nice shower, comfortable bed with a variety of pillows, internet that was fast and best of all - no adult movies. I didn't even have to look at the ads. Breakfast was free and filling with cereal, eggs, toast, muffins, potatoes, and drinks. As a family man this is place to go either on business or with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the $$$ we paid”
Reviews.Author: Julious
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and got a room for $36 + tax. Room could have been a little cleaner, but not bad. Reserved a king bed, was told by front desk person upon check-in that it was a king bed room, but was actually only the size of a queen. Whatever...we didn't pay much for the room, and a good breakfast buffet was included. Hotel is at 635 & 75, very close to our appointment. Pleased overall...would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite North Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samhatcher
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service and good rates keep me coming back here to stay. Full breakfast buffet included at no extra cost is a nice extra. Good wireless internet service. Convienently located at 75 and 635 in north Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathleenR3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over here for one evening and thought it was a great hotel at a terrific price. Our room was clean and modern but the wi-fi signal was poor.

Reviews.Title: “We were lied to! Beware! and stay away!”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegBeverley
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to say that the serving staff in the Restaurant were incredible. As was the food - both breakfast and dinner. Delicious and plentiful. The serving staff were helpful (gave us directions to local points of interest) were friendly, and very pleasant to deal with. The front desk staff (I beleive) are not trained properly. We asked them for directions and they could not help us. Didn't even try, or make suggestions. I think they were overwhelmed and too busy to process thoughts. And now the bad stuff.... Cleanliness wasn't the best. We stayed for a week and the bathroom floor was not swept once during that time. Mold (small spot) growing on the bathtub grout. This was not significant enough that we would change hotels for though. The bad stuff happened upon checkout. We reserved for a 7 night stay last fall, and were quoted an excellent rate. That is why we chose this hotel. When we checked in, the gal at the front desk tried to give us a significantly higher rate. We showed her our e-mail from the hotel, stating the rates. She said she would make the change. We watched the weather channel on TV everyday, and saw that there was a storm moving into the midwestern states. Becasue we were driving back to Canada, we decided that we would try to beat the storm system and leave 2 nights early. We informed the front desk 48 hours in advance of our leaving. When we went to check out, we saw that our Credit cards had already been charged, and at a higher rate than we were quoted - and again, a different rate from the one quoted to us a check in time. We again pointing out the significantly lower rate that we were quoted via e-mail last fall. The staff did not know what to do and called the manager. He refused to honour the rate quoted because we were leaving early! So what's the point of having a rate quoted at all? Obviously, once they have your credit card, they can put through whatever rate they feel like. We explained again, that we had the rate confirmed and he again, told us that he did not have to honour that as we chose to leave early. I was VERY upset. I told him, and I'll tell you, that I have stayed at hotels (some Best Westerns) all over North America and I have NEVER experienced this before! I told him that I believed what he was doing was criminal, and I believe it is. This is just wrong, wrong, wrong. SO beware fellow travellers. And check your credit card statement! This manager is dishonest and I sincerly hope that A) you avoid this facility and B) Best Western takes a look at this. I cannot believe that the Best Western name will stand behind such underhanded transactions.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel for Less”
Reviews.Author: DirahH
Reviews.Content: Room was confortable & rates were excellent. I got half-off per night for booking 4 or more nights. The breakfast buffet was good...pancakes / french toast was delicious. I really enjoyed my stay. My only complaint was it was a little too cold in the buffet room and it was the middle of December.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: suzilla
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for several meetings and this hotel was conveniently located near everything I needed. I forgot some important things at home and the front desk went above and beyond to help me out. Hotel seemed to have been fully renovated and the beds were super comfortable. I won't be staying anywhere other than the Best Western Hotels and Conference when I'm in the Dallas area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: coalincash
Reviews.Content: I think there isn't enough to say how much this hotel did for me. I loved the staff, and I loved the fact that the hotel seems more luxury than a run down hotel. The only real thing I could ask for was a bigger room, but that small request would not stop me from staying at this hotel. The internet could be bumped up a couple of notches, but it was reliable. I have always liked Best Westerns in the past, but this one was by far the best. With a great rate, there was no problems. If I ever do come back to Dallas, I think I'll choose this great hotel. Before I booked this hotel, I had some second thoughts based on security. This hotel is secure enough if you're smart about it. I would like to thank this hotel for a great stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Laughmaster
Reviews.Content: Great staff who made me and my conference attendees feel welcomed and special. The lunch provided for our group of 100 + was excellent, especially for the price. Great service. I never had to go looking for anyone. I will be back next year and the year after that. Highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff I have ever had a pleasure to meet.”
Reviews.Author: texanSouthBendIN
Reviews.Content: The best value for the money, and the best staff in town!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed better than home. Good stay”
Reviews.Author: NannyMTexas
Reviews.Content: Comfort of bed was exceptional. Slept very well. Conference room ammenities were very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: AholaBaby
Reviews.Content: The bed was Amazing.........Beautiful Room and Great View! I really enjoyed it and will be making weekend getaways!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I was more than satisfied with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BTJ1977
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a great hotel especially for the price. The staff was nice from the time we checked in and even helped us with directions. I also liked the design of the room. It felt upscale and comfortable. I really had no complaints during my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nicely Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalya1299
Reviews.Content: When I hear the name Best Western, it does not always evoke the image of luxury, usually budget.-friendly. However, this Best Western was recently renovated. I believe a buyout of another hotel chain. The lobby was very opulent with nice marble floors and gold fixtures. The sleeping rooms were very well appointed as well. Nice tv, linens, and furniture. The only downside was there was a leaky sink, which was repaired. But the leak was also to blame for the waterbug found in the room. Now that alone would probably scare away travelers, but it was handled very well by the hotel staff and the rooms and hotel itself were very nice. So, let's just hope if you visit this hotel, you will not get a leaky sink. That would allow you to rate this a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service: Two thumbs up.”
Reviews.Author: FlacaFierce
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff of the this particular Best Western. I have stayed at other Best Westerns before all across the country but none compare to how friendly and helpful your front desk staff was, specially in the mornings. I traveled from Florida to Dallas for a pleasure trip and I was hoping to find a hotel that met all of my needs, and was affordable. Trust me when I say that I am very picky with where I'm staying with my kids and I can't stress enough how worth it my stay was. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: Brooke079
Reviews.Content: Incredible customer service. Extremely courteous and professional, this is a hotel that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Palms0322
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel the staff was rude, we couln't check in because it was before "check in time". The next day we had bed bug bites all over, called down to the desk and they said they would change the sheets?????? Came down to the front desk and the guy in front of me is complaining that his car got broken into. I knew it was time to go. Cheap price but not worth the trouble since I had to pay additional money to stay somewhere else. Horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “bugs in bed”
Reviews.Author: ladylike7777
Reviews.Content: we came from a long flight from overseas and needed some good sleep. What we got instead where alot of bed bugs biting us over an hour till we woke up and left the hotel in a hurry! check your pillow covers before you decide to lay down.

Reviews.Title: “Rewritten, with a Warning”
Reviews.Author: Rhonlynn
Reviews.Content: If you read the review I previously wrote for this hotel,I was happy, until I glanced at my bank account,and realized they had subtracted 50.00 for incidentals.I set up my trip on hotels.com. I got a great rate, and a good location. They asked me for my credit card for verification at check in.I didn't think anything about it, cause i've stayed in dozens of hotels, paid for by my employer, and am asked for verification. The thing I don't like about this particular hotel is that they don't explain that there is a $50.00 subtraction from your card. It's not the subtracting the money that I'm unpleased about, it's the fact that they dind't say anything about it. Hampton Inn will tell you up front. Travelodge and Holiday inn doesn't do this.
