Neither does Super 8 or even some best Westerns. My advice is, if you can, look for another hotel. I called the hotel long distance, spoke with customer service, spoke with my bank, and it will be settled in about 3 days. Incidentals? Well, we were there for such a short time, that there weren't any incidentals used. I don't appreciate the hotels inability to not say their charges up front,and from this point forward, when we go back, we will either stay in McCallister or a bit past Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: dallas2009
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and conveniently located. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: anjellyca721
Reviews.Content: Great price, friendly staff, great breakfast, GM is very customer service oriented!

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renscout
Reviews.Content: 1st off after paying in full on Hotels.com they required a CCard,I asked why they said in case of incidentals. Got to my room had an Email saying they charged $50 to my card.(BTW 5 -10 business days to clear after released from hotel) Now some of the money that we were going to spend shopping tied up on hold from Hotel. I did not give them permission to charge my card any amount. 2nd ordered Pizza from card in room(after driving 650 miles was too tired to go out)Made to look like outside company delivering to motel,Price $12.95 X 2 for combo pizza total charged to me was $38.74 $6.34 auto 20% Gratuity + $2 room service charge (not outside company Hotel room service)Then all it was was a frozen DiGiorno I could buy for $5 and local Store. 3rd web site, book in hotel and Hotels.com say they offer free cont breakfast. Was given 1 coupon per person on arrival(staying 2 days). Next day asked for coupon for 2nd days breakfast was told only 1 coupon per visit. 4th 5 Ice machines on 5 floors NONE WORKED bought my own at Convenience store. 5th 2 elevators on site only 1 worked 6 floor hotel w\197 rooms This was the worst stay I have had in any Hotel EVER. Mini Vacation w\wife was totally ruined by staff. My opinion is that once they seen that I got a cheaper rate from Hotels.com they were trying to get the money back in other ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlcola2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it a very relaxing. Outstanding service from the staff. Comfortable rooms with upgraded bed and shower. Good internet access also

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for room problems but good breakfast in morning.”
Reviews.Author: flyingham1
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son and his family so we stayed here. When I made the reservation I requested a non-smoking room and verified that with a telephone call to the reservation center. Our plane was very late so we also had guaranteed late arrival. They gave away our non-smoking room and only had a smoking room left. Bad smell! Then the phone did not work at all. The TV Menu function (for movies etc) did not work. The toilet flush handle was broken. We reported the phone and TV problem every day and they NEVER WERE FIXED. The toilet was fixed within 30 minutes of our complaint. Room VERY SMALL! If there had been a fire or other emergency we could not use the phone. When we checked out (7 day stay) we again reported the problems and this time the person at the desk said he was the manager and he had not heard of these problems. If that is trus I can only say the service and communication there is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “OK if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: AnotherMark
Reviews.Content: Just a room. Room a little dated. Bathroom rather small. Breakfast buffet ok. Staff nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY great location for upscale BW Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NLtravel
Reviews.Content: EXTREMELY great location of an upscale Best Western Hotel. I use this hotel all the time when I come in to Dallas for Business. The pillow top mattresses are just fabulous and the feather pillows as well.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed every”
Reviews.Author: bikerbabe679
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the service I received at this hotel. The customers service desk was very acomindating. The beds are very comforable, I looked forward to going to bed every night. I will book this hotel next time I'm in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpell
Reviews.Content: This hotel just went through a very nice upgrade. I stayed here on business and was pleasantly surprised at the improvements. My room was clean, the staff was wonderful. I enjoyed the on-site restaurant, which had good food and excellent service. I had a TV problem, called the front desk and maintenance had it fixed in 10-minutes! I travel regularly and I recommend this hotel and I will not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Office Holiday Party”
Reviews.Author: scottishrep
Reviews.Content: Recently our office had their holiday party at this property. Hugo and all of the staff were extremely helpful and made it a wonderful event. They were very accomodating even when we made some last minute requests and changes to our needs for our banquet room. Everyone one there went over and above to make our event the best yet. Hope that we can continue this annual party there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, but at what cost?”
Reviews.Author: shalomyeshua
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a trip to dallas and stayed at this hotel. The rates per night where great for the quality the location, but I cant say I was overall satified with the service of the staff. I had to wait an hour to check in all the while people where checking in. The shower drain doesnt drain very well and the water pressure is very "up and down." Also I found a roach behind the couch. I am now experiencing difficulties with overcharges from the hotel and no matter how many times I call I can never seem to get a manager. Overall I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump.”
Reviews.Author: rmphillips72
Reviews.Content: Horrible property, dirty and cheap. You might think this Wyndham should be a nice place but it is comparable to a motel 6 and attracts the same type of guest. Renovations that they promote are poor at best. Front desk staff is rude and flat out lied to me. I was given a room that was already occupied! Check your sheets for cleanliness. Don't expect much if you plan to stay here and I recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: tiggersuncity
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, the bathroom only had room for a standing alone sink. The AC wouldn't work on low. We didn't have a pillowtop mattress as advertised. The worst part, the elevator door closed on my husband's arm and left a large bruise and blood running down his arm. There were 3 employees of the hotel in the elevator and did nothing. The halls were very hot. The door into the hotel closed on me while going in.The employees at the front desk were very rude. Not ample parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value”
Reviews.Author: graceoliver
Reviews.Content: Although check in was a bit slow, they needed more help at 4:30 PM, and I was accidentally sent to the wrong room on a smoking floor which was immediately corrected to the non-smoking room I had booked, but after I had to stand in line 15 more minute, it was on the most part a very nice hotel. It was a good value for the price, they had a great breakfast included with the room on the package I purchased online. We are talking a complete buffet with fruit, made to order omelets, juice, coffee etc. Very good. They also have a very nice bar with 1/2 price margaritas at happy hour. The restaurant was closed the night we wanted to eat there, but they will serve you a complete southwestern menu at the tables in the bar, and since no one was smoking, it was quite pleasant, and the food was really good and reasonably priced. The room was VERY clean, and the beds extremely comfortable. I would guess that the bedding was new since it was so comfortable. All and All it was a pleasant stay, about 30 minutes East of DFW and well located right off of 635 East.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: KrisCee
Reviews.Content: Our company was holding a conference at the hotel, so I decided to book a room for the week- for the convenience. The first room was a "non-smoking" room, but the hallway that led to it was full of smoke and smelled terrible. Once in the room, there were burns and stains all over the carpet. I went to the front desk and told the clerk that I was not impressed with the room, and she assured me the room was non-smoking, but eventually gave me another room close the lobby. It smelled better, but still had stains all over the carpet and walls. I found a hair in the blanket of one bed. The bathtub was rusted and the mattresses were as hard as a rock, and to top it all off, I was located right by the ice machine which provided noise all night. I cancelled the rest of my week's reservations and moved to a Marriott nearby. There is a reason this hotel is cheaper! It's in desparate need of updatingl! Ewww!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for business travel at least for me!”
Reviews.Author: traveler2828
Reviews.Content: The room that I stayed in was acceptable. It was a bit small from what I expected at other Wyndham Hotels in the past. I am a Wyndham By Request member myself and my small bottle of wine and cookies were there on the desk. I stayed for one night checking in on December 19th, 2007. The bathroom had an older style pedestal sink but it was in good repair. They have nice shelves installed to make up for the lack of counter-top space. The bathtub was clean but not properly level as a low spot collected water and did not drain completely after my shower. I have included photos of the room that I stayed in. I hope this helps with other people thinking of staying at this hotel. I ate in the bar as the restaurant was closed in the week leading up to Christmas. I had Fettucine Alfredo with Chicken and it was good. The Tomato Basil soup was only warm, not hot but the service was fine. I was the only patron eating at the time. The hotel is in a built up part of Dallas quite close to the Texas Instruments business park at the intersection of Texas 75 and I-635. I stayed on the 6th floor in a non-smoking room. This is the top floor for this hotel. The room was clean and reasonably well appointed. It may very well be that this room was updated in the recent past. The pillows in the bed were acceptable but not spectacular. The high speed internet connection was a wired connection and it was free for me (perhaps because I am a Wyndham By Request member) and quite fast. I did not watch TV and so cannot comment on the channel selection. When checking out, I picked up a USA Today and a Wall Street Journal, both provided to guests for free down in the lobby. This hotel is conveniently located to the freeway and is approximately 20 -30 minutes from Dallas Fort Worth airport. If you have business in the area, I would recommend this hotel based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Female-Biz-Traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel expereinces I have had in a long time. As a frequent business traveler, I only require a clean room/hotel and a courteous staff. Though the hotel is in the midst of a remodel, that is not an excuse for dirty rooms and a poor staff. I was sent to three different rooms that already had guests asleep in them (note, I arrived at 10:30 pm). The fourth room had dirty carpet, not to mention the 2 bugs crawling on the bathroom floor. Too tired/late to change hotels, I was put in a 5th room (a smoking room and I am a NON-smoker). Within 15 minutes another guest used a key provided by the desk at his check-in, to attempt to get in (he apologized profusely!). The next morning when I told the front desk about all of the issues, I simply got a "Sorry about that!". I will NEVER stay at this hotel again - and sadly, will approach all Wyndams with caution in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rough hotel in a rough part of town”
Reviews.Author: SoutheastBizTravel
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? - The hotel is run-down and in desperate need of a renovation. Examples include stains in the carpet everywhere - even in the lobby, mold in the bathrooms, burned out lightbulbs, - Unfriendly staff. I'm a Wyndham ByRequest member and I verified when I made the reservation that my member number was included in the reservation. When I checked in, they had no idea I was a member and I did not get my complimentary drink or cookie. - The second day of the stay my room key card did not work. Twice. Three sets of keys and three trips back down to the lobby before they figured out the issue. Not one apology or mention of my time being wasted or inconvenence. Just a shrug from an indifferent front desk clerk. - The bar is too dark and the bartender is clueless. She may be a nice person but she has no idea how to bartend. The gin and tonic I ordered was water. The draft beer she poured was fine, but then again it is hard to screw up a draft beer! There are plenty of other hotels within a few miles. Most are more money and I will gladly pay more - a lot more - versus staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some improvments, but good location”
Reviews.Author: gatorhon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip to Dallas. The room seemed old and musty smelling. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and the pillows didn't have much support. I expect a bit more from the Wyndham. The bathroom was not exactly clean as I found several hairs that did not belong to me. I also seemed to have problems getting the A/C to stay on and not continually shut off. My group did enjoy the bar area for a few cocktails and the complimentary shrimp cocktail was a nice surprise. I probably would look for another hotel in the area if visiting Dallas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best out there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small (I could not have stayed a week). There was some mold on the tile around the tub faucet. I felt that I needed to put towels down on the bathroom floor to walk through it. You have to pay for internet access. TV viewing is very limited, although, you could pay $12.99 to watch a new release or $3.99 to watch a sea lion program on the Discovery channel. We did watch a program on National Geographic channel for free. Breakfast buffett is $9.95 for one buffet. I made one local phone call for 50 cents. They have advertised on the website that a sony playstation is included with room and I called to find out what games/movies they have available and was told they no longer have playstations in the room. I asked if we could bring ours and hook it up and they told me that we could, but when we arrived there was no way to hook a playstation the way they have the TV hooked up. I do have to say that all the employees are extremely friendly. I forgot my shampoo and the shampoo that they provided was really good shampoo. I normally use pantene and was afraid my hair would feel icky, but it did not. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Wyndham for the weekend. For the price we paid, we were shocked at how nice the hotel was. The staff was excellent and everything was above our expectations. You could tell that the hotel was a little older, but who were we to complain. The only thing I could find wrong was that the pillows were a little lumpy, so you might want to bring your own. Other than that, the hotel was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at a really good price”
Reviews.Author: bontemps
Reviews.Content: A great location right off LBJ and around the corner from the galleria....we had two nice and quiet nights at the Wyndham. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the restaurant (Sophie's) had a nice breakfast buffet and the rooms were clean and comfortable. A very good deal at the $75 a night rate I got, especially after shopping Manhattan hotels for next month!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sjd74
Reviews.Content: A good hotel which served me well for a week's exploring the area. The only down-side was the quality of the rooms. The carpet was badly stained, the shower head had come away from the wall, the bath plug was broken and the tiling dirty in places. For the price I paid, it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm currently sitting in my room at this hotel connected via a 10.00 per day extra charge and I have to say that I am dissapointed in this hotel. While the price was cheap, for the reviews I saw on this site I expected a very nice room. When I got to the hotel the lobby is very nice and the person at the desk was curteous and efficient, but as I went to my room on the second floor the smell of smoke in the hallway was very strong. The room itself has a very very musty smell. The carpet looks very old and the wallpaper looks like it's about to start peeling at the seams. The room is rather small. The bathroom is clean and functions well, it seems like it might have been remodeled in the not too distant past, but it is very small as well. There is no counter at the sink only a pedestal basin. There is basically no soundproofing between the bathroom and the room itself, and the fan in the bathroom does pretty much nothing for the steam from the shower. The channels on the TV come in fuzzy as well. I haven't yet checked out the rest of the hotel or the pool. But basically, it's okay for the price, but it's small and the musty smell bothers me.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Fan For Life!”
Reviews.Author: bright_eyes1
Reviews.Content: This had to be the best hotel I have ever stayed in! It had the most beautiful, cleanest bathrooms, best staff, and nicest rooms, especially for the price. I am extremely happy with how everything turned out. I was a bit worried because I got such a great webdeal, but it was perfect! This is the ONLY hotel I will ever stay in the next time I visit Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Represented Dallas well”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 2 night stay back in October 2004, made our mini-vacation so much more relaxing than expected. My husband & I travel often and don't mind settling for a hole in the wall hotel for a quick sleep over. BUT, this vacation was a real treat. NOT a hole in the wall at all!!. It was TOTAL LUXURY for us. We didn't know what to expect since we had a very good room rate from an on line booking service, but we were more than pleased upon arrival. The staff was exceptional and so were the very, very nice rooms. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels in Dallas leading to some good prices in comparison compared to cities that offer fewer rooms relative to the number of visitors to the carea, so finding deals on room rates is no surprise. But being able to get a room at this little Wyndham property for $40-70 is a real steal. The only issue with the hotel is that the elevator is somewhat inaccessible unless you park by a particular door, but that hardly seems such a big deal with the nice rooms and excellent atmosphere. There is a "library" like sitting room between the lobby and bar that just beckons the traveler to sit and rest a while.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like A VIP!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel after driving for 4 hours, and looking tired and rumpled, we were graciously welcomed by a friendly, smiling front desk agent. After a quick check-in, we headed down the interior hall to our room. When we opened the door, much to our surprise, we found feather pillows on the bed, and a snack and cold drinks waiting for us on the desk! In the bathroom were luxurious Golden Door Spa toiletries. The room was clean and had a fresh scent. The furnishings appeared to be new and were very stylish. A few minutes later, the front desk called and asked if we were satisfied with the room. What a nice gesture! There is a sitting room adjacent to the front desk that has exquisite furnishings--the perfect place to meet or converse prior to dinner--or afterward--or anytime! Dinner in the restaurant was excellent--great food, great service--and the prices were very reasonable. The pool area is also an excellent place to wind down after a busy day shopping. I will definitely stay at this hotel again next time I visit Dallas!
